jobs.title: Data Engineer - Scala
jobs.description:
As a Data Engineer, you will join a team of 10 passionate and talented developers in order to design and develop a new data architecture.
 
We collect several billions of events per days, which represents hundreds of gigas of datas , 2,000 to 3,000 messages/seconds and 15% of new datas each month. 


Your daily work will consist in: 
•	Designing efficient architectures to stock et analyze petabytes of data 
•	Implementing complex acquisition workflows and analyze data to bring out possibilities of jobs that haven’t been untapped yet.
•	 Participating to the implementation and the enrichment of datalakes based on Hadoop ecosystem 
•	Thinking of smart data format to serve the functionalities of the product, while minimizing the costs 
•	Developing tools to help data-scientists to work with available clusters 
•	Documenting your work, prove that it works and make it work better ! 
… by using some open source technos Elasticsearch, Akka, Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, etc.


Do you have excellent technical qualities?

With a minimum of 3 years of experience (up to 10 years), you master one or several back-end languages (Scala, Java, Python). You practice or have interest in functional programming and seek to develop your skills on Scala.

Kafka, Akka, Spark, Hadoop… You had the chance to discover or work on these big data technologies. Ideally, you have some experience on NoSQL data sets, more particularly ElasticSearch and you are interested in streaming. You would like to challenge yourself on distributed infrastructures in real time and data-intensive environment. You like to share your skills and take part into technical choices. 


Why join ContentSquare’s Data Engineering team? 

•	If you are looking for a variety of cool projects, which revolutionize analytics and UX with big data
•	If you are interested in contributing to open source projects as well as investing yourself on the tech scene by organizing meetups and presenting topics to conferences 
•	If you are looking for an environment where you’ll have the occasion to be a technical referent on your areas of expertise, while taking responsibilities on strategical corporate axes 
•	If you share our “quality focused” vision : code reviews, sprint for the quality of the code, coverage of unit and functional tests. 

Then, join us at ContentSquare and be a part of  this awesome adventure, with tech teams that are as passionate as you are, who cultivate knowledge sharing and team cohesion. Through Hackathons, Cross teams Innovation Days, we are committed to experiment/create tomorrow’s user experience. 

You’ll also find : the possibility to choose your PC/Mac, flexible working hours, remote days, basketball, handball, yoga, and many other sports teams, afterworks with beers provided every Fridays, monthly parties…and a very nice team !

jobs.title: Fullstack JavaScript Software Engineer
jobs.description:
Are you willing to participate to the development of a software which revolutionizes e-commerce, thanks to processing large volumes of data, using cutting edge technologies such as Node.js & Angular.js ?

We are precisely looking for a Fullstack Javascript Developer ! 


Your responsibilities :

Within an agile team of 10 people, your goal will be to enrich our SAAS application, a SPA Angular using APIs based on the framework hapi – Node.js. 
We give a high importance to user experience, the quality of the interfaces that we deploy and mainly to the quality of the code. 
Your daily work will consist in: 
•	Taking keys technical decisions and helping to define the global technical vision
•	Evangelizing on code’s quality of, design and tests
•	Implementing new features of ContentSquare’s product
•	Writing client and server’s code to provide successful and ergonomic web applications 
•	Ensuring the reliability, the scalability and the efficiency of the SAAS application
	 
Stack : NodeJS, Angular, JavaScript, Elasticsearch,...


Do you have excellent technical qualities?

As an enthusiastic follower of good practices of development, you have at least 1 year of experience on a MV*Javascript framework as well as in API development.

Nodejs and Angular have ideally no more secrets for you. 

We are open-minded regarding your fullstack path, as long as you are proficient in Javascript and in another backend language such as java or python, and ready to develop/extend your skills on Angular and Nodejs!


Why join ContentSquare’s Application team? 

•	If you are looking for a variety of cool projects, such as working on Large Single Page Application with intensive visualizations of data
•	If you are interested in contributing to open source projects as well as investing yourself on the tech scene by organizing meetups and presenting topics to conferences 
•	If you are looking for an environment where you’ll have the occasion to be a technical referent on your areas of expertise, while taking responsibilities on strategical corporate axes 
•	If you share our “quality focused” vision: code reviews, sprint for the quality of the code, coverage of unit and functional tests. 

Then, join us at ContentSquare and be a part of this awesome adventure, with tech teams that are as passionate as you are, who cultivate knowledge sharing and team cohesion. Through Hackathons, Cross teams Innovation Days, we are committed to experiment/create tomorrow’s user experience. 

You’ll also find : the possibility to choose your PC/Mac, flexible working hours, remote days, basketball, handball, yoga, and many other sports teams, afterworks with beers provided every Fridays, monthly parties…and a very nice team !

jobs.title: Customer Success Associate
jobs.description:
ContentSquare is a fast-growing startup founded in 2012 with the mission to improve digital experiences across the board. To do this, we developed an innovative Saas solution that helps businesses understand how people are behaving on their digital platforms and how they can optimize the customer journey.

 We love having a close relationship with our customers such as Walmart, Tiffany & Co, l’Occitane, Kering, L’Oréal, and more.
 Since 2012 we have had a 150% YOY growth and raised $42M in Jan 2018 to accelerate our international expansion with one goal: to be the leading Digital Experience Insights platform thanks to the infinite possibilities of AI.
With offices in Paris, London, New York, Germany and expanding throughout North America and Asia we have a great International team with tons of career opportunities, a unique environment with strong values, fun atmosphere, very exciting vision and culture!

We have 50 passionate and talented engineers from our R&D team working on developing the best UX analytics software.

As a Customer Success Associate, you will guide new clients in the optimal use and adoption of the ContentSquare solution. As the first point of contact for your clients in their relationship with ContentSquare, you will be responsible of providing them with the best onboarding experience and empowering them to use the tool autonomously.

Responsibilities:

- Ensuring solution’s implementation and adoption within clients’ organisation:
- Identifying key users of the solution and building strong relationships with them (operationals and executives)
- Leading training sessions and guiding users on their path to becoming autonomous
- Engaging clients’ in the use of the solution by providing them with dedicated and bespoke support, by identifying their strategic business goals
- Configuring and analysingclient data within the ContentSquare tool
- Co-ordinating actions to ensuring clients’ satisfaction:
- Ensuring the adoption of the solution and providing personalised solutions for usage optimisation
- Co-ordinating internal resources to cater for client needs (Data Analysts, Solution Integration Manager, Product team, Customer Care)
- Being the voice of the clients and providing internal feedback on how ContentSquare’s solution can be improved
- Keeping customers updated on the latest ContentSquare developments, resources and events

Profile:

- Exceptional presentation, written and oral communication skills
- Good understanding of Analytics, A/B test and Data oriented businesses
- A dedication to customers and an enthusiastic mindset 
- Ability to adapt to different clients’ situations and provide the best suited solutions
- Comfortable working in a fast-paced, technically challenging environment
- At ease with managing multiple projects at the same time
- Native English speaker

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will join a team of passionate and talented developers, designing and developing a new data architecture. Do not hesitate to check on our YouTube video to see what it's like to be a Data Engineer at ContentSquare!

We collect several billions events per day, and query hundreds of terabytes in real time. 

Your daily work will consist of: 
•Designing efficient architectures to store and analyze petabytes of data 
•Leading large scale projects and mentoring other developers 
•Implementing complex acquisition workflows 
•Thinking of smart data formats to serve the functionalities of the product, while minimizing the cost 
•Developing tools to help data-scientists 
....by using some open source technologies such as Kafka, Spark, Akka, ClickHouse, Elasticsearch, etc. 

With a minimum 6-7 years of experience, you are proficient in either Scala or Java, and ideally several other backend languages. You practice or have an interest in functional programming and seek to develop your skills in Scala. 

Kafka, Akka, Spark, AWS… You have had the chance to discover or work with these big data technologies. Ideally, you have some experience on a wide range of databases and you are interested in streaming. You would like to challenge yourself developing distributed infrastructure with a real time and data-intensive environment. You would like to share your skills and take part in technical choices. 

Why join ContentSquare’s Data Engineering team? 
•You are looking for a variety of cool projects, which will revolutionize analytics and UX with big data 
•You are interested in contributing to open source projects as well as investing in the tech scene by organizing meetups and presenting at conferences 
•You are looking for an environment where you’ll have the occasion to be a technical referent on your areas of expertise, all while taking responsibilities on strategical corporate axes.

If the above sounds like a great fit to you, then join us at ContentSquare and be a part of this awesome adventure. With tech teams that are as passionate as you are, cultivate knowledge sharing and strive for team cohesion. Through hackathons, and cross team innovation days, we are committed to innovate towards tomorrow’s user experience. 

You’ll also have: a choice of PC or Mac, flexible working hours, remote days; soccer, handball, yoga, and many other activities; after work beers provided every Friday, monthly parties…and a very friendly team! Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!







As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Sr Customer Success Manager - Digital Analytics SaaS
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

En quelques mots : 

Nous recherchons un(e) Customer Success Manager pour renforcer notre équipe à Paris et accompagner notre forte croissance. Rattaché(e) directement au Lead Customer Success Manager, vous serez responsable de l’onboarding, de l’engagement, de l’accompagnement et du succès de votre portefeuille de clients. 

Vos missions

Customer Success Management :

- Développer une relation de confiance (Trusted Advisor) avec les Sponsors (C-Level)
- Responsable de la relation Client de l’onboarding au renouvellement du contrat
- Définir et mettre en œuvre des stratégies d’accompagnement personnalisées
- Contribuer à la stratégie UX digitale et à la roadmap AB testing des Clients
- Veiller à l’adoption de la solution au sein de l’organisation du Client
- Etre garant de la preuve de valeur (ROI) : reporting, calls, RDVs, Business Reviews
- Engager les clients dans la communauté des Utilisateurs Contentsquare
- Qualifier et adresser avec assiduité toute problématique impactant le renouvellement
- Identifier les opportunités de développement du portefeuille en partenariat avec l’équipe commerciale

Management de projet :

- Gestion de planning, coordination des équipes internes, communication interne/externe
- Maîtrise fonctionnelle de la plateforme Contentsquare
- Contribution à l’interprétation des données issues de Contentsquare
- Porte-parole du Client pour l’amélioration et le développement de nouvelles fonctionnalités 

N'hésitez pas à aller voir Maca, membre de l'équipe à Paris, pour mieux découvrir l'expérience Contentsquare en tant que CSM ! 


Votre profil
- Vous avez un minimum de 4 ans d’expérience sur un poste similaire dans le digital et l’UX
- Le monde du SaaS n'a plus de secret pour vous
- Vous êtes à l'aise avec des interlocuteurs aussi bien opérationnels que C-level et savez gérer un projet impliquant plusieurs parties prenantes
- Vous avez une bonne compréhension des outils d’analyse/AB testing
- **Vous parlez anglais couramment.** Suédois, Norvégien... La maîtrise d'une de ces langues est un gros plus ! 
- Votre communication (écrite et orale) est irréprochable
- Les relations humaines sont primordiales pour vous
- Vous êtes proactif et autonome
- Vous voulez rejoindre une équipe internationale qui valorise l’esprit d’équipe, l’ambition, la créativité, l’enthousiasme et la diversité


Bon à savoir
- Poste en CDI
- Localisation : Paris 1er (près de la Madeleine)
- Date de début : dès que vous êtes disponible !





As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

Are you willing to participate in the development of software which revolutionizes e-commerce, thanks to processing large volumes of data, using cutting edge technologies such as Node.js, Kafka and Angular ? 
We are precisely looking for a Senior Fullstack Software Engineer! 
Do not hesitate to check on our YouTube video to see what it's like to be a Software Engineer at ContentSquare!

Within an agile team, your goal will be to enrich our SaaS application, a SPA Angular using Node.js APIs.
We highly value user experience, the quality of the interfaces that we deploy, and the quality of the code. 

Your daily work will consist of:

- Making key technical decisions and helping to define the global technical vision
- Leading large scale projects and mentoring other developers 
- Evangelizing the code quality  and tests
- Consolidating our distributed architecture - recently switched to micro-services - with better isolation of our services and the creation of new analytical products, built on our stack, to better meet the demands of our customers, particularly in the US
- Implementing new features for ContentSquare’s product
- Writing client and server code to provide successful and ergonomic web applications
- Ensuring the reliability, the scalability and the efficiency of the SaaS application 
 Stack : NodeJS, Angular, VueJS, Kafka, Nest...


As an enthusiastic follower of good practices, you will have at least 5 years's experience on back and front end development  as well. Ideally NodeJS and Angular have no more secrets for you.

We are open-minded regarding your fullstack background, as long as you have experience working with Javascript and another backend language such as; java, python, or other;  and ready to develop/extend your skills on Angular, Nodejs and Kafka!

Why join ContentSquare’s Application team?
- If you are looking for a variety of cool projects, such as working on a Large Single Page Application with intensive data visualizations 
- If you are interested in contributing to open source projects as well as investing in the tech scene by organizing meetups and presenting at conferences
- If you are looking for an environment where you’ll have the occasion to be a technical  referent on your areas of expertise, all while taking responsibilities on strategical corporate axes
- If you share our “quality focused” vision: code quality, code reviews, and code coverage (unit and functional tests).

If the above sounds like a great fit to you, then join us at ContentSquare and be a part of this awesome adventure. With tech teams that are as passionate as you are, cultivate knowledge sharing and strive for team cohesion. Through hackathons, and cross team innovation days, we are committed to innovate towards tomorrow’s user experience. 

You’ll also have: a choice of PC or Mac, flexible working hours, remote days; soccer, handball, yoga, and many other activities; after work beers provided every Friday, monthly parties…and a very friendly team! Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!




As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Android Software Engineer
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

We are looking for developers with 2+ years of professional experience in Android who are inspired in developing a tool that analyzes and deciphers user experience patterns creating a platform that helps increase conversion rates in mobile applications.

Your responsibilities :
- Develop an analytics SDK on Android
- Collaborate with engineers from other teams, QA and product to design features and break down high-level goals into tasks. Build, document and maintain features and tests.
- Provide strong architectural designs.
- Provide thoughtful feedback to other members of the team via code reviews. 
- Work in an Agile environment with a TDD mindset.

Stack: Java (Android), Kotlin

Why join Contentsquare’s SDK team?
- Dive deep into  Android platform secrets unveiling that there is more than just UI and design.Improve your algorithm and design patterns skills. 
- Stay up to date with tech scenes whether by organizing meetups, presenting or participating in conferences and hackathons.
- Automation. Whether it's building, shipping, testing or validations, we automate basically anything we can get our hands on.
- Have the opportunity to be the technical referent on your area of expertise while taking responsibilities on strategic corporate axes. If you share our “quality focused” vision: code reviews, sprint for the quality of the code, and coverage of unit and functional tests.

- Flexible working hours with remote days

jobs.title: CRM and Database Intern (German Speaker)
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a fast-growing startup founded in 2012 with the mission to improve digital experiences across the board. To do this, we developed an innovative SaaS solution that helps businesses understand how people are behaving on their digital platforms and how they can optimize the customer journey.

We love having a close relationship with our customers such as Real, Tom Tailor, Cyberport, and more.

Since 2012 we have had 150% YOY growth and raised $60M in Jan 2019 to accelerate our international expansion with one goal: to become the leading Digital Experience Insights platform thanks to the infinite possibilities of AI.

With offices in Paris, London, New York, Munich and expanding throughout North America and Asia we have a great international team with tons of career opportunities, a unique environment with strong values, a fun atmosphere, a very exciting vision and culture!

The role:  

We’re seeking an enthusiastic student with a passion for technology and excellent organisational skills to join our growing team in our central Munich office on a flexible basis (4-5 days a week for a paid internship for 6 months). 

The candidate would ideally have previous experience in data entry/management and a keen interest in the technology space. This role will play an integral part in building our database in the DACH region. 

We get it, database building isn’t THE most exciting role, but we’ll make up for it in providing other development opportunities and wider marketing/sales experience as well as immersing you in all of the great team events and other benefits we have to offer in our empowering and dynamic culture. 


Typical tasks include:
- Ensuring our marketing database is clean and all of the brands and roles are assigned correctly
- Prospecting net new companies for our SDRs (sales development representatives) to engage with
- Move current offline process to Salesforce.com
- Analyse success of marketing campaigns (send times/subject lines etc). 


About you:
- Current student 
- Perfect level of German and good level of English
- Exceptional project management skills and understanding how to manage the priorities of multiple stakeholders 
- Must have demonstrable mastery of Microsoft Excel 
- Experience of building database / data entry is a huge plus 
- Experience with Salesforce and Hubspot (or any marketing automation tool) is a huge plus
- Enjoys working in a dynamic startup culture


Worth knowing: 
- As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer: 
- A creative and collaborative marketing team 
- A sociable office with a monthly happiness budget with regular events ranging from rooftop barbecues and footgolf tournaments to Oktoberfest fun with the team
- An office fully-stocked with coffee, softdrinks, fruit and snacks and an in-house table soccer
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development


To apply please send your CV and a few lines telling Janine Kanters, our Head of Marketing DACH, why you believe you’d be a perfect candidate and why this role appeals. 


Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!

jobs.title: Customer Success Enablement Manager - Expression of interest
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

We are looking for a Customer Success Enablement Specialist to join our team in Paris or London and play a key role in scaling our fast-growing Customer Success organization. You will be responsible for delivering onboarding and ongoing development activities that help our Customer Success teams achieve their goals.


On a typical day you might: 
- **Partner with Customer Success representatives** on their opportunities to help them translate Customer Success Enablement training into active knowledge 
- Participate in the preparation and execution of **customer QBR and important calls**
- **Create, activate, and update content to enable the Customer Success team** on key skills, messaging, competitive differentiation, product knowledge, and process
- **Develop strong cross-functional partnerships** and collaboration between Customer Success, Sales, Marketing, Product, Product Education and Services to deliver information to the Customer Success team at the right time and in the best format for consumption and adoption
- **Support new product release rollouts** to ensure the Customer Success team has all the information and content to properly promote the new capabilities
- **Provide maximum feedback to product team** to guide them in identifying market needs and product requirements needed for growth 
- Coach, test, and certify the field for maximum effectiveness
- **Leverage various learning strategies to deliver training** to our global teams including e-learning, self-study, instructor-led techniques, and certification programs
- Iterate, and **improve upon, the onboarding process for Customer Success** to accelerate ramp time
- **Measure and report on the effectiveness** of enablement investments and programs
- Collect feedback regularly and practice **continuous improvement of the programs** to keep up with the needs of the teams
- **Partner with Customer Success leadership** to **identify skill development needs** and align enablement priorities to Customer Success org initiatives and priorities


What you'll need to succeed: 
- **Fluency in English**
- Experience with preparing and delivering value-oriented **Customer Success conversations / presentations** for **SaaS enterprise Customer Success meetings**
- Experience with **enterprise digital analytics or A/B testing solutions** (e.g. Adobe, Maxymiser, Optimizely, etc.), working on the vendor or consulting side
- Strong interest and curiosity in SaaS products
- Proven experience in product marketing, enablement, or enterprise customers
- Ability to engage and inspire through both content and delivery
- Great interpersonal skills that span across various cultures and professional backgrounds as this role will support our team across multiple countries
- Proven success in designing, developing, and facilitating customer success enablement programs for high growth SaaS organizations
- Self-motivated, proactive, energetic team player
- Approaches work with empathy and a creative, problem solving mindset
- Ability to connect the dots organizationally and influence stakeholders from various roles, levels and profiles to drive collaboration and program excellence


Good to know: 
- Contract: full-time permanent position 
- Location: **Paris or London office** 
- Start date: As soon as you're available!


NB: The recruitment process on this role in on hold for now. You can still apply but you may be contacted later, when the situation improves.


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager - Digital Analytics SaaS
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

En quelques mots : 

Nous recherchons un(e) Customer Success Manager pour renforcer notre équipe à Paris et accompagner notre forte croissance. Rattaché(e) directement au Lead Customer Success Manager, vous serez responsable de l’onboarding, de l’engagement, de l’accompagnement et du succès de votre portefeuille de clients. 

Vos missions

Customer Success Management :

- Développer une relation de confiance (Trusted Advisor) avec les Sponsors (C-Level)
- Responsable de la relation Client de l’onboarding au renouvellement du contrat
- Définir et mettre en œuvre des stratégies d’accompagnement personnalisées
- Contribuer à la stratégie UX digitale et à la roadmap AB testing des Clients
- Veiller à l’adoption de la solution au sein de l’organisation du Client
- Etre garant de la preuve de valeur (ROI) : reporting, calls, RDVs, Business Reviews
- Engager les clients dans la communauté des Utilisateurs Contentsquare
- Qualifier et adresser avec assiduité toute problématique impactant le renouvellement
- Identifier les opportunités de développement du portefeuille en partenariat avec l’équipe commerciale

Management de projet :

- Gestion de planning, coordination des équipes internes, communication interne/externe
- Maîtrise fonctionnelle de la plateforme Contentsquare
- Contribution à l’interprétation des données issues de Contentsquare
- Porte-parole du Client pour l’amélioration et le développement de nouvelles fonctionnalités 

N'hésitez pas à aller voir Maca, membre de l'équipe à Paris, pour mieux découvrir l'expérience Contentsquare en tant que CSM ! 


Votre profil
- Vous avez un minimum de 4 ans d’expérience sur un poste similaire dans le digital et l’UX
- Le monde du SaaS n'a plus de secret pour vous
- Vous êtes à l'aise avec des interlocuteurs aussi bien opérationnels que C-level et savez gérer un projet impliquant plusieurs parties prenantes
- Vous avez une bonne compréhension des outils d’analyse/AB testing
- **Vous parlez anglais couramment.** Suédois, Norvégien... La maîtrise d'une de ces langues est un gros plus ! 
- Votre communication (écrite et orale) est irréprochable
- Les relations humaines sont primordiales pour vous
- Vous êtes proactif et autonome
- Vous voulez rejoindre une équipe internationale qui valorise l’esprit d’équipe, l’ambition, la créativité, l’enthousiasme et la diversité


Bon à savoir
- Poste en CDI
- Localisation : Paris 1er (près de la Madeleine)
- Date de début : dès que vous êtes disponible !





As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

  • Votre communication (écrite et orale) est irréprochable
  • Les relations humaines sont primordiales pour vous
  • Vous êtes proactif et autonome
  • Vous voulez rejoindre une équipe internationale qui valorise l’esprit d’équipe, l’ambition, la créativité, l’enthousiasme et la diversité

Bon à savoir

  • Poste en CDI
  • Localisation : Paris 1er (près de la Madeleine)
  • Date de début : dès que vous êtes disponible !

As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:

  • Plenty of opportunities for training and development
  • Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
  • Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
  • Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
  • Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
  • 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
  • Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager - Digital Analytics SaaS
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Farringdon seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

ContentSquare is looking for a passionate Customer Success Manager (CSM) to strengthen its UK team. Based in London and reporting to the Customer Success Lead, in a fast-growing company, you will manage a portfolio of customers and serve as a central point of contact for the customer during the entire live cycle of their usage of the ContentSquare Solution.

As a trusted advisor, facilitator, advocate and coach, the CSM’s role is to ensure that customers achieve their strategic business goals and realize value from their ContentSquare product, ultimately translating into renewal and upsell of the client’s subscription. The CSM will build and maintain strong relationships with multiple contacts within the assigned customers, including executive roles.

The CSM will be responsible for driving adoption and utilization across their customer base. The CSM will also work closely with Sales and renewals management to help drive renewals to a successful completion.
In this role, the CSM will also work closely with cross functional ContentSquare groups (Product, Customer Services, Marketing, Customer Care, Engineering, etc.) and will be required to build and maintain strong working relationships within those groups. Ultimately the CSM will own the customer’s post-sales experience serve as an escalation point for issues that impacts the customer’s success.




What you will do
- Lead, manage and participate in activities that drive product adoption, active use, ContentSquare awareness, and customer satisfaction
- Proactively monitor and address customer success issues
- Contribute to your customer's digital UX strategy and AB test roadmap
- Understand and assess customer requirements
- Develop and maintain a trusted advisor relationship with customer executive sponsors such that all activities are closely aligned with the customer's business strategy, allowing the full potential of their ContentSquare Solution to be realized
- Establish and oversee the customer's adoption, training and usage/development of best practices to continually drive incremental value and return on the customer's investment
- Identify and grow opportunities and collaborate with sales teams to ensure growth attainment
- Drives regular cadence (Call/Report/visit/QBR) with customer to report on KPIs, raise awareness of ContentSquare news / events.  Shares results & actionable items with cross-functional stakeholders.
- Drive renewals to a successful completion in close collaboration with Sales
- Contribute in pre-sales positioning of Customer Success deliverables and sales led kick-off meetings with customers to outline expectations, communication rhythm, and how we support customer’s KPIs
- Follow-up of operations: planning management and coordination of internal services resources (technical, UX, UI and data analysts) during each step of the customer journey
- Configuring and analyzing the customer data on the ContentSquare tool
- Create value by Co-production of analysis and training workshops with the customer
- Be the voice of the client and provide internal feedback on how ContentSquare’s solution can be improved


What you need to succeed
- Relevant work experience (Minimum of 2 years in a similar position)
- Experience in Post-Sales-Account-Management for subscription based Solutions,
- Background and technical experience in Digital Solutions
- Very Good understanding of the Analytics, A/B test and Data businesses
- Must be highly self-managed, responsive, with the passion to serve the customer,
- Exceptional presentation, written and oral communication skills,
- Very structured working approach, ability to deal with several different activities in parallel,
- Demonstrable ability to take ownership and act on client goals and objectives,
- Ability to influence and drive issue resolution with cross-functional teams in a matrix organization,
- Proven track record in teaming with sales and field organizations to achieve business goals. 
- Fluency in English
- French would be a bonus


Measurement for success would include
- Increased customer satisfaction across account (measured by conventional surveys, as well as reference potential of account & general check-ins and customer feedback)
- Drive Product adoption rates
- Successful and timely renewals


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance, and French family care policy after 1 year of employment
- Fun office culture with regular socials and perks ranging from go-karting, junkyard golf and rooftop curling to in-office massages, basement jazz trips, brie and boardgame evenings and movie nights
- An office fully-stocked with (decent) coffee, breakfast, fruit and snacks (plus a regular supply of chocolate hobnobs)
- Travel opportunities to our global offices for onboarding, the Hackathon, and our annual worldwide kickoff trip

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager - New York City
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in New York City, seeing explosive growth following $122 million of funding. Recognized by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.

We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioral insight.

About the role:

As a CSM at Contentsquare, you will be our customers’ trusted advisor, facilitator, advocate, and coordinator.  As you build and maintain relationships with senior leaders and executives within your account portfolio, you will ensure that our customers achieve their strategic business goals and realize value from their Contentsquare product, ultimately translating into renewal and upsell of the client’s subscription.  

In addition to working within our global Customer Success team, you will partner with Sales and Renewals management to help drive renewals to a successful completion.  You will also build strong internal relationships with cross-functional teams (Product, Professional Services, Customer Care, Product Experience teams, etc.).  Ultimately, you will own the entire post-sales customer experience as well as be an escalation point for issues which impacts the customer’s success.

What you’ll do as a CSM at Contentsquare:

-Proactively lead and maintain ongoing relationships with enterprise level Executive Sponsors, including sharing of best practices, thought leadership, & industry trends.
-Proactively monitor and manage customer success issues; have a clear understanding and ability to assess customer requirements
-Proactively work with Executive Sponsors to establish critical goals and other key performances indicators
-Contribute to the customer’s digital UX strategy, optimization roadmap and integrations in collaboration with the Product Experience Manager
-Drive regular touch points (calls/reports/meetings/QBR) with the customer to report on partnership KPIs and help to promote Contentsquare news / events
-Share results & actionable items with cross-functional stakeholders in collaboration with Product Experience Manager
-Collaborate with Sales Teams to identify & expand opportunities to ensure growth attainment
-Drive renewals to successful completion in close collaboration with Sales
-Contribute in pre-sales positioning of Customer Success deliverables
-Lead kick-off meetings with Sales to outline expectations, communication rhythm, and how we support customer’s KPIs
-Oversee internal operations: planning management and coordination of cross-functional services/resources (Technical, Services, Adoption and Sales) throughout each step of the customer journey
-Develop engagement/success plan with clear deliverables and clear communication of the plan across functions (Marketing, Sales, Product, Customer Operations)

To succeed in the role, you are:

-Experienced in the SaaS industry (at least 5 years), ideally in Marketing Technology or analytics
-Gifted in building client relationships at the exec and C-level
-Inquisitive & proactive
-Understanding of user needs/goals and their business
-Focused on ROI / Proof of value
-Experienced in project management (Engagement plan: Schedule, Milestones, Stakeholders, …)
-Autonomous
-A partner to the sales team
-Experienced with digital analytics / optimization




In addition to the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business, we also offer:

- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Competitive coverage on a variety of health, dental and vision insurance plans 
- Competitive parental leave offering after 1 year of employment
- Opportunity to contribute to a 401K
- Unlimited PTO 
- Summer Fridays
- Fun office culture with a big opportunity to make an impact on our growing US team culture, including a rotating Culture Crew (including both office and remote teams) for you to help organize regular outings such as game nights, movie nights, and happy hours
- An office fully-stocked with coffee (or an espresso machine if you'd like!), breakfast, fruit and snacks
- Trips to our global offices for onboarding, the Hackathon, and our annual worldwide kickoff trip

jobs.title: Customer Support Engineer - Expression of interest
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

We're looking for a Customer Technical Support Engineer to join our team and help support our customers across the globe. 
Contentsquare’s Customer Support Engineers are technically skilled, love working with customers, great problem-solvers and creative thinkers.  Based in Paris and reporting to our Customer Support Lead, Alexandre Dumont, you will have the opportunity to interface with our key customers and work on exciting and complex customer inquiries. This position offers a great opportunity for you to grow your career within the growing Customer Support team. 
If you're excited by the idea of being part of a rapidly growing web/app analytics company where you can grow your technical skills, let's meet!


On a typical day, you may: 
- Provide first line diagnostic/troubleshooting support and technical expertise to answer customer questions, troubleshoot and resolve specific product related issues while maximizing customer satisfaction. 
- Respond to, resolve and document all incoming cases reported by customers, account managers, customer success managers and sales engineers via telephone, web, and other support channels as required.
- Gather and analyze information, evaluate impacts, resolve or escalate issues as needed Manage customer and internal stakeholder’s expectations around resolutions and timelines 
- Deep investigation of issues, PII handling, work with different stakeholders to bring fast resolution 
- Ensure support service level agreements (SLAs) are managed and met
- Deliver training sessions and webinars about Contentsquare’s products for internal personnel 
- Act as a Customer-facing subject matter expert
- **Flexibility in participating in a rotational on-call schedule during extended shifts (weekdays) and weekends as needed**
- **Able to travel up to 15%**


What you'll need to succeed: 
- **You can speak English fluently and can speak & write at a professional level in French**
- You have **2+ years’ experience in providing customer facing support to Enterprise Accounts**.
- You have knowledge/experience in JavaScript, HTML, CSS. 
- You are able to work in a fast-paced startup environment
- You have a strong desire to teach new customers about the platform, with strong communication and interpersonal skills


Ways to stand out from the crowd: 
- Experience in working in a web, SaaS environment
- Experience in JIRA, SalesForce and Zendesk
- SQL knowledge


NB: The recruitment process on this role in on hold for now. You can still apply but you may be contacted later, when the situation improves.


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

  • Experience in JIRA, SalesForce and Zendesk
  • SQL knowledge

NB: The recruitment process on this role in on hold for now. You can still apply but you may be contacted later, when the situation improves.

As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:

  • Plenty of opportunities for training and development
  • Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
  • Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
  • Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
  • Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
  • 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
  • Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a fast-growing startup founded in 2012 with the mission to improve digital experiences across the board. To do this, we developed an innovative SaaS solution that helps businesses understand how people are behaving on their digital platforms and how they can optimize the customer journey.

We love having a close relationship with our customers such as Walmart, Tiffany & Co, l’Occitane, Kering, L’Oréal, and more.

Since 2012 we have had 150% YOY growth and raised $60M in Jan 2019 to accelerate our international expansion with one goal: to become the leading Digital Experience Insights platform thanks to the infinite possibilities of AI.

With offices in Paris, London, New York, San Francisco, Munich, Tel Aviv and expanding throughout North America and Asia, we have a great international team with tons of career opportunities, a unique environment with strong values, a fun atmosphere, a very exciting vision and culture!

What are we looking for?

Contentsquare is searching for a Data Analyst who will be an expert in User Experience and work closely across departments to help Fortune 500 companies optimize their websites. 

The role

Leaders throughout the organization turn to Data Analysts for their expertise in both the product and the field of User Experience. The Data Analyst will work with Customer Success, Sales, Marketing, Product and Engineering teams to demonstrate the value of Contentsquare to clients, and help them achieve business objectives. Data Analysts dive into the raw data Contentsquare collects in order to discover impactful insights.


Responsibilities
- You will work closely with world-renowned digital clients from various verticals (e-commerce, travel, finance, content) analyzing the performance and customer experience on their websites. This involves understanding the clients’ business goals and major problem areas, identifying opportunities for optimization and growth, and producing actionable recommendations with concrete impact on the clients’ bottom line.
- Applying a mix of qualitative and quantitative analysis techniques you will produce insights that help businesses improve the customer experience on their websites and ultimately increase conversion. Apart from establishing yourself as a Contentsquare master you will become comfortable in the web analytics ecosystem and draw on data from other web analytics tools such as Google and Adobe Analytics.
- You will work independently on deliverables tailored to the needs of each client and their specific business questions. You will own your research findings and present them to major stakeholders and key decision makers on the client side ensuring you deliver a clear message that businesses can act upon.
- You will initiate innovative ideas for new products within Contentsquare using the raw data that will eventually be included within the Contentsquare offerings.


Requirements
- We are looking for people who know how to ask the right business questions, formulate relevant KPIs, recognize trends and opportunities and build a story that convinces clients to take actions. You should be able to understand customers and evaluate digital experience.
- **Native English speaker, both written and spoken.** The role includes regular presentations to top stakeholders at Fortune 500 companies in North America and Europe.
- **Education: you have a bachelor's degree or higher,** preferably in a quantitative discipline or social sciences with quantitative research experience. Alternatively, you have equivalent army experience in similar fields.
- **Professional experience: you live and breathe the internet.** You bring your personal experience knowing how a good website works. Professional experience working in web analytics or user experience is an advantage.
- **Analytical skills: you approach data with the right questions and know how to recognize trends** ; you develop and use structured approaches to identify root causes and opportunities. You cross validate your findings using data from multiple sources; the capacity to learn new methods of analysis and constant self-learning are critical. **Experience with SQL is an advantage.**
- **Presentation skills: you don’t report stats or send out reports – you tell stories backed up by data.** You are comfortable presenting to a broad audience of stakeholders, and are not afraid to defend your findings in a discussion. You know how to formulate and present your story depending on the audience.
  
- Others:Open to occasional travel
- Working days are Monday to Friday


Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!

jobs.title: Data Analyst US
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in New York City, seeing explosive growth following $122 million of funding. Recognized by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.

We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioral insight.

About the opportunity:

We are a web analytics platform that helps E-commerce clients understand the actions andbehaviours that users are performing on their websites through analysis of user journeys,session-level metrics (time spent, conversions, activity), and in-page behaviours (clicks,hovers, scrolls etc). We’re looking for someone with a passion for data and interest in digitaluser experiences. We work with a large portfolio of high-profile clients so you will gainunparalleled, first-hand experience into the digital business strategies for a wide range ofCompanies.

Being a data analyst at Contentsquare requires a combination of technical, analytical skills,as well as consulting and client-facing skills. Within the technical skillset, knowledge ofstatistics, mathematics, SQL/database-querying, Excel, and general abilities in making senseof big data are extremely valuable. Within the client-facing, consulting skillset, we’re lookingfor a candidate comfortable in presenting and talking through data with clients, and anability to construct logical, convincing narratives from data.

You will work within the Professional Services team, managed by a Lead Data Analyst whowill be responsible for your onboarding and training. Analyzing is a team effort, and you willbe working closely with our UX Designers, UI designers and Customer Success Managers onprojects. These projects will give you the opportunity to build and develop something completely new that could be used by our business to improve our ability, and our clients ability, to deriving insights from the data.


What you’ll be doing:
- You will work closely with world-renowned digital clients from various verticals (e-commerce, travel, finance, content) analyzing the performance and customer experience on their websites. This involves understanding the clients’ business goals and major problem areas, identifying opportunities for optimization and growth, and producing actionable recommendations with concrete impact on the clients’ bottom line.
- Applying a mix of qualitative and quantitative analysis techniques, you will produce insights that help businesses improve the customer experience on their websites and ultimately increase conversion. Apart from establishing yourself as a Contentsquare master you will become comfortable in the web analytics ecosystem and draw on data from other web analytics tools such as Google and Adobe Analytics.
- You will work independently on deliverables tailored to the needs of each client and their specific business questions. You will own your research findings and present them to major stakeholders and key decision makers on the client side ensuring you deliver a clear message that businesses can act upon.
- You will initiate innovative ideas for new products within Contentsquare using the raw data that will eventually be included within the Contentsquare offerings.
- (Occasional travel required)


Who we’re looking for:
- You are a strong learner and confident in your numeral, written, and verbal skills.
- You can effectively translate technical jargon to non-technical people. You enjoy explaining what you know and using data to tell stories.
- You are comfortable presenting to a broad audience of stakeholders, and are not afraid to defend your findings in a discussion. You know how to formulate and present your story depending on the audience.
- You have previous work experience or training in working with numbers and data, or have demonstrable experience in numerical analysis.
- Experience using SQL: if not, the strong evidence-based interest in learning SQL as well as other technical skills such as Python knowledge or HTML/CSS/Javascript.
- Knowledge of the digital ecosystem: analytics, traffic acquisition, e-commerce strategies.
- Strong Excel abilities, and experience with Google docs/sheets/slides.
- Any of the following skills/experience is a plus: other analytics, knowledge of Python, R, statistics, data science, UX Design, client-facing presentations, data visualizations, AB test strategies.
- You have a bachelor's degree or higher, preferably in a quantitative discipline or social sciences with quantitative research experience. 


In addition to the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business, we also offer:

- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Competitive coverage on a variety of health, dental and vision insurance plans 
- Competitive parental leave offering after 1 year of employment
- Opportunity to contribute to a 401K
- Unlimited PTO 
- Summer Fridays
- Fun office culture with a big opportunity to make an impact on our growing US team culture, including a rotating Culture Crew (including both office and remote teams) for you to help organize regular outings such as game nights, movie nights, and happy hours
- An office fully-stocked with coffee (or an espresso machine if you'd like!), breakfast, fruit and snacks
- Trips to our global offices for onboarding, the Hackathon, and our annual worldwide kickoff trip

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

As a Data Engineer, you will join a team of passionate and talented developers, designing and developing a new data architecture. Do not hesitate to check on our YouTube video to see what it's like to be a Data Engineer at ContentSquare!

We collect several billions events per day, and query hundreds of terabytes in real time. 

Your daily work will consist of: 
•Designing efficient architectures to store and analyze petabytes of data 
•Leading large scale projects and mentoring other developers 
•Implementing complex acquisition workflows 
•Thinking of smart data formats to serve the functionalities of the product, while minimizing the cost 
•Developing tools to help data-scientists 
....by using some open source technologies such as Kafka, Spark, Akka, ClickHouse, Elasticsearch, etc. 

With a minimum 2-3 years of experience, you are proficient in either Scala or Java, and ideally several other backend languages. You practice or have an interest in functional programming and seek to develop your skills in Scala. 

Kafka, Akka, Spark, AWS… You have had the chance to discover or work with these big data technologies. Ideally, you have some experience on a wide range of databases and you are interested in streaming. You would like to challenge yourself developing distributed infrastructure with a real time and data-intensive environment. You would like to share your skills and take part in technical choices. 

Why join ContentSquare’s Data Engineering team? 
•You are looking for a variety of cool projects, which will revolutionize analytics and UX with big data 
•You are interested in contributing to open source projects as well as investing in the tech scene by organizing meetups and presenting at conferences 
•You are looking for an environment where you’ll have the occasion to be a technical referent on your areas of expertise, all while taking responsibilities on strategical corporate axes.

If the above sounds like a great fit to you, then join us at ContentSquare and be a part of this awesome adventure. With tech teams that are as passionate as you are, cultivate knowledge sharing and strive for team cohesion. Through hackathons, and cross team innovation days, we are committed to innovate towards tomorrow’s user experience. 

You’ll also have: a choice of PC or Mac, flexible working hours, remote days; soccer, handball, yoga, and many other activities; after work beers provided every Friday, monthly parties…and a very friendly team! Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!







As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Digital Analytics Manager
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Farringdon seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

As a Product Experience Manager based in London, you will be a part of the Customer Success team, working very closely with the Customer Success Manager and Customer Onboarding Manager.

The Product Experience team is accountable for developing a deeper understanding of Contentsquare’s product capabilities, with the aim of spreading an innovative analysis methodology to our clients. You are ideally an excellent problem solver and insight provider that shines in data storytelling.

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to contribute to the development of our rising Product Experience function within London. The ideal candidate will have experience in a client facing role using analytics tools and would easily identify web optimization opportunities. You must thrive in a startup environment, be proactive, data-driven and eager to learn.


On a typical day, you may
- Participate in activities that drive product adoption, active use and Contentsquare awareness across your portfolio of customers
- Advocate on the behalf of the customer and represent their needs with internal product teams
- Proactively identify customers with low adoption and develop strategies to increase usage and stickiness with the product
- Create value by producing analysis and customised workshops with the customer based on job functions and verticals while leveraging innovative approaches, tools, and methodologies in collaboration with Customer Success Managers
- Be the go-to-lead for the adoption and awareness of new features with a proactive and consultative approach with customers
- Maintain knowledge of new product features to address the customer’s business needs, including attending new feature workshops and training
- Participate in client meetings with Customer Success Managers to understand customers’ business challenges and ensure Contentsquare usage is effectively targeting the customers’ key objectives and KPIs


We’d love to meet someone who:
- Has 1-3+ years experience in an analytical role in Technology/Consulting/SaaS/Digital
- Holds a degree in Business, Marketing, Big data, Statistics or another related UX field
- Has strong communication skills, a first client-facing experience and a customer-first attitude
- Has a demonstrated interest in the Internet, software, and technology; Most notably, you have a good understanding of web analytics and website optimization
- You have a robust knowledge of the digital analytics market 


Ways to stand out from the crowd:
- Fluency in a Nordic language is a plus
- Web development knowledge (HTML, CSS, JS, tagging technologies)
- Knowledge in CRO / AB Testing
- Skills in SQL and any other data exploration languages
- Experience with BI tools (ie Looker)
- User Experience or Cognitive Science knowledge


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance, and French family care policy after 1 year of employment
- Fun office culture with regular socials and perks ranging from go-karting, junkyard golf and rooftop curling to in-office massages, basement jazz trips, brie and boardgame evenings and movie nights
- An office fully-stocked with (decent) coffee, breakfast, fruit and snacks (plus a regular supply of chocolate hobnobs)
- Travel opportunities to our global offices for onboarding, the Hackathon, and our annual worldwide kickoff trip

jobs.title: FP&A Analyst
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a fast-growing startup founded in 2012 with the mission to improve digital experiences across the board. To do this, we developed an innovative SaaS solution that helps businesses understand how people are behaving on their digital platforms and how they can optimize the customer journey.

We love having a close relationship with our customers such as Walmart, Tiffany & Co, l’Occitane, Kering, L’Oréal, and more.

Since 2012 we have had 150% YOY growth and raised $60M in Jan 2019 to accelerate our international expansion with one goal: to become the leading Digital Experience Insights platform thanks to the infinite possibilities of AI.

With offices in Paris, London, New York, San Francisco, Munich, Tel Aviv and expanding throughout North America and Asia, we have a great international team with tons of career opportunities, a unique environment with strong values, a fun atmosphere, a very exciting vision and culture!

The FP&A analyst will be an integral part of the finance department and report to the Head of FP&A.


The analyst will support the following: 
- Preparation of financial reports, Budgets, Forecasts, Management and Board of Directors materials, monthly financial analysis materials and ad hoc analysis needs of the company.
- Budget preparation and on-going tracking of actual vs. budget analysis.
- Rolling forecasts of the company and manage the long-term financial model.
- Month-end and quarter-end financial reports.
- Work with Sales operations, Business intelligence and other key stakeholders to generate requested reporting and information.
- Provide decision making support analysis for projects, customer transactions and other initiatives.
- Manage the monthly commission plan calculations for payroll.
- Drive key insights and analytics.


Requirements:
- Bachelor’s degree in one of the following disciplines: Finance, Economics, Accounting
- 2-4 years of experience as a FP&A in a High-Tech company, preferably in subscription revenue environment- SAAS
- High degree of proficiency with Excel
- Experience with financial planning and analysis functions, including annual budget, long-term strategic planning and resource allocation processes
- Understanding of accounting and finance principals
- Good analytical skills
- Organized, flexible and easily adaptive to changing conditions
- Ability to work well in high pressure situations to meet deadlines
- Ability to multi-task and manage numerous simultaneous priorities
- Fluent in English

jobs.title: Fullstack Software Engineer
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

Are you willing to participate in the development of software which revolutionizes e-commerce, thanks to processing large volumes of data, using cutting edge technologies such as Node.js, Kafka and Angular?
We are precisely looking for a Fullstack Software Engineer!
Do not hesitate to check on our YouTube video to see what it's like to be a Software Engineer at ContentSquare!

Within an agile team, your goal will be to enrich our SaaS application, a SPA Angular using Node.js APIs. We highly value user experience, the quality of the interfaces that we deploy, and the quality of the code.

Your daily work will consist of:
- Implementing new features for ContentSquare’s product
- Writing the code quality and tests
- Consolidating our distributed architecture - recently switched to micro-services - with better isolation of our services and the creation of new analytical products, built on our stack, to better meet the demands of our customers, particularly in the US
- Contributing to projects, pairing other developers and mentoring less experiences ones
- Writing client and server code to provide successful and ergonomic web applications
- Ensuring the reliability, the scalability and the efficiency of the SaaS application
- Be involved in key technical decisions and spread the global technical vision at ContentSquare

Stack : NodeJS, Angular, VueJS, Kafka, Nest...

As an enthusiastic follower of good practices, you will have at least 3 years's experience on back and front end development as well. Ideally NodeJS and Angular have no big secrets for you.

Any other experiences on another backend language such as: java, python, or other is more than welcome! And if you know kafka or have used on production other event bus, it will be priceless. 

Why join ContentSquare’s Application team?
- If you are looking for a variety of cool projects, such as working on a Large Single Page Application with intensive data visualizations
- If you are looking for an environment where you’ll have the occasion to work with people having excellence skills in some areas
- If you are a challenger-driven, a team player and want to contribute to a on promise technical stack
- If you share our “quality focused” vision: code quality, code reviews, and code coverage (unit and functional tests).

If the above sounds like a great fit to you, then join us at Contentsquare and be a part of this awesome adventure. With tech teams that are as passionate as you are, cultivate knowledge sharing and strive for team cohesion. Through hackathons, and cross team innovation days, we are committed to innovate towards tomorrow’s user experience.





You’ll also have: a choice of PC or Mac, flexible working hours, remote days; soccer, handball, yoga, and many other activities; after work beers provided every Friday, monthly parties…and a very friendly team! Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: HR Assistant UK & Germany
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Farringdon seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.


As part of the structuring of our HR / People team, we are looking for an HR Assistant to support Contentsquare in this exciting period of growth.   
 
Why join ContentSquare
 
ContentSquare is experiencing exceptional growth and especially in its international market.
This is a position offering great autonomy, in which your ability to proactively suggest ideas and manage your assignments will be valued. This is an opportunity to quickly learn skills on various topics!
 


Responsibilities
- Assisting with Legal compliance and policy build
- Onboarding management (offer letters, contract, amendments, follow-up trial period, health insurance, inductions)
- Welcome our new employees & follow-up on their onboarding
- Payroll management: relationship with our service providers, answering employees' questions, sending variable elements, solving errors encountered
- Various responses to employee requests (certificates, support)
- Monitoring and updating information, integration and internal communications documents
- Case study and management of international mobility processes (visas requests & renewals for foreign employees, relationships with instances, writing memos)
- Legal research, memos preparation for the HR team
- Update reports and employee follow-ups, sorting and management of employee files
- HRIS management (employee information, leave, documentation, etc.)
- Participation in the construction of our HR Roadmap


Our ideal candidate
- We are looking for a person with a minimum one year's experience in HR or Recruitment, preferably in a high-growth environment. We welcome HR graduates to apply.
  
- The following qualities will be highly appreciated:
- Excellent communication and comprehension skills
- Strong accuracy and attention to detail
- Excellent listening and interpersonal skills; 
- Ability to work well under pressure
- Superior time management & organisational skills
- Respect of confidentiality
- Sense of responsibility, commitment and organization


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance, and French family care policy after 1 year of employment
- Fun office culture with regular socials and perks ranging from go-karting, junkyard golf and rooftop curling to in-office massages, basement jazz trips, brie and boardgame evenings and movie nights
- An office fully-stocked with (decent) coffee, breakfast, fruit and snacks (plus a regular supply of chocolate hobnobs)
- Travel opportunities to our global offices for onboarding, the Hackathon, and our annual worldwide kickoff trip
