jobs.title: Head of Partnerships, APAC
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a fast-growing startup founded in 2012 with the mission to improve digital experiences across the board. To do this, we developed an innovative SaaS solution that helps businesses understand how people are behaving on their digital platforms and how they can optimize the customer journey.

We love having a close relationship with our customers such as Walmart, Tiffany & Co, l’Occitane, Kering, L’Oréal, and more.

Since 2012 we have had 150% YOY growth and raised $60M in Jan 2019 to accelerate our international expansion with one goal: to become the leading Digital Experience Insights platform thanks to the infinite possibilities of AI.

With offices in Paris, London, New York, San Francisco, Munich, Tel Aviv and expanding throughout North America and Asia, we have a great international team with tons of career opportunities, a unique environment with strong values, a fun atmosphere, a very exciting vision and culture!

The Asia Pacific and ANZ market is a strategic market for Contentsquare and this role presents a unique opportunity to be one of the charter members of an awesome global Partners’ team and of the new Contentsquare APAC team. Reporting to the Executive VP of Global Business Development & Partnerships, you will help implement & improve our partner process in a new territory whilst understanding the key business challenges our product and services solve. We are a fast-growing company, and need people who will take initiative and ownership when executing new business in the field.


Responsibilities
- Building and driving the regional partner strategy
- Uncovering new partners and making them become Contentsquare experts
- Recruiting, training and enabling partners (Digital Agencies, Consultancy firms, Technology firms and Technology Partners) with the focus on new business
- Localizing global partner relationships Contentsquare has in different regions Working closely with Contentsquare sales, pre-sales, marketing and inside sales, on closing large enterprise deals
- Develop and maintain a sales strategy and business plans. Use the business plan as a roadmap for a 'Go to Market' and including sales goals.
- Focus on maintaining and deepening relationships with Partners to create increased sales opportunities.
- Be seen and treated by Partners as a trusted and valued resource, an advisor to them.
- Achieving revenue targets and goals for the territory


Requirements:
- Experience in channel management mandatory (2 years minimum)
- Relevant experience in SaaS, ASP, eBusiness or CRM software
- An intrinsic drive to be successful
- A degree (BA/BSc) or equivalent
- Successful sales track record in exceeding assigned individual quota upwards of $1M
- Experience in both a start-up and established business will be a bonus
- Strong communication and presentation skills (verbal and written)
- You have a competitive nature in some fields (e.g. athletics, chess, whatever)
- Fluency in any language other than English would be a bonus


Please note this role can be based in either Singapore or Australia


Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!

jobs.title: Human Resources Intern - Expression of interest
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

You want to join a tech scale-up experiencing exceptional growth and international development? You want to quickly learn skills on various topics in HR? 

We are looking for an intern to join our HR team in Paris and support Contentsquare in its ambitious Human Resources needs! As an integral part of the team, you will work with our HR Coordinator, Kseniia, to monitor the full life cycle of employees. 


On a typical day you may:
- Manage the full new hire admin process (contract, amendments, trial period followup, health insurance, DPAE etc.)
- Welcome our new employees and follow up on their onboarding process, help with the organization of onboarding sessions
- Be able to answer various requests from employees (certificates, support...)
- Manage international mobility processes (visa requests & renewals for foreign employees, investigate on new cases)
- Update reports and employee follow-ups, sort and manage employee files using our HR Information System
- Various watch and legal research, monitor & update integration and internal communication documents
- Participate in payroll management in relationship with our service providers
- Participate in cross-functional HR / HR policy projects


We would love to meet you: 
- **You are a student** from a business school or a university, with a strong interest in Human Resources, ideally with a similar first experience in a fast-growing company
- Excellent communication skills (oral and written) are essential in **French** , as well as in **English** (#international)
- You have a synthetic and analytical mind, excellent listening and interpersonal skills
- Enthusiasm and respect for confidentiality will be highly valued as well as a sense of responsibility, commitment and organisation


Good to know:
- 5 or 6-month internship ideally
- Start date: as soon as you’re available!
- Location: in the very centre of Paris (1er arrondissement, métro La Madeleine)
  
NB: The recruitment process on this internship in on hold for now. You can still apply but you may be contacted later, when the situation improves.

As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer to interns:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Reimbursement of 50% of Navigo Pass - "tickets restaurant" 
- 1 day off per month of internship
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday, quarterly parties and yoga lessons. 
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Implementation Manager (French speaking)
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a fast-growing startup founded in 2012 with the mission to improve digital experiences across the board. To do this, we developed an innovative SaaS solution that helps businesses understand how people are behaving on their digital platforms and how they can optimize the customer journey.

We love having a close relationship with our customers such as Walmart, Tiffany & Co, l’Occitane, Kering, L’Oréal, and more.

Since 2012 we have had 150% YOY growth and raised $60M in Jan 2019 to accelerate our international expansion with one goal: to become the leading Digital Experience Insights platform thanks to the infinite possibilities of AI.

With offices in Paris, London, New York, San Francisco, Munich, Tel Aviv and expanding throughout North America and Asia, we have a great international team with tons of career opportunities, a unique environment with strong values, a fun atmosphere, a very exciting vision and culture!

Responsibilities:
- Manage the Onboarding and Ongoing Technical activities for Contentsquare's Customers and Prospects
- Act as the main point of contact for any technical implementation related matters
- Manage Customer and Internal Stakeholders' expectations during Onboarding and Deployment
- Work closely with Contentsquare's Account Managers and Customer Success Managers and lead technical implementations


What we are looking for:
- Experience in technical implementation or support roles in SaaS Company
- Strong working proficiency in web technologies like Javascript, CSS, HTML
- Proven experience in customer-facing roles with preferably SAAS organizations of global companies
- Good understanding of Agile development processes and Methodologies-advantage
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
- Exemplary written and verbal communication skills - French
- Managing and prioritizing multiple projects at the same time
- The ability to work well in a global, dynamic, cross-functional, team-based environment  
- Experience with mobile apps technology – advantage
- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related fields - advantage


Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!

jobs.title: In-house Legal Counsel
jobs.description:
Responsibilities
•	You will manage, draft and negotiate all forms of company contracts, including but not limited to NDA’s, SaaS Agreements, Service Level Agreements, Partner Agreements and Vendor Agreements
•	You will help develop and implement standard templates, forms and processes
•	You will provide training to the sales and to the operational teams from the different departments on processes, compliance and new legislation
•	You will acts as the legal resource and trusted legal advisor, getting to balancing risks and providing sound advice to the management and support business functions.
•	You will advise different teams all across the company on mitigating legal risks
•	You will handle other project-based work within the scope of the legal department responsibilities on as-needed basis
Required Qualifications:
•	Minimum 5 years UK commercial and corporate experience providing legal advice and negotiating agreements in a SaaS/technology/start-up environment, preferably with an international company
•	Proven ability to work in a team and experience dealing directly with Clients and Business Partners
•	Demonstrate a highly commercial approach and love working in a fast-moving, business-oriented environment typical of high-technology startups
•	Able to work at incredible speed and with focus is a must for this role, candidates must be able to prioritize responsibilities to manage a large workload with very tight timelines
•	Excellent written and verbal skills in English are essential
Qualifications:
•	You are able to demonstrate success working with sales teams in customer negotiations
•	You have an in-depth understanding of UK contract law and software contract requirements and strong skills in negotiating SaaS agreements
•	Experience contracting with large corporations and/or public sector is a plus.
•	You are familiar with data privacy and protection law and practice, particularly in relation to SaaS offers
•	You are familiar with agencies and systems integrator agreements.
•	You must be qualified and admitted to practice commercial and contracts law in UK.

jobs.title: Lead Customer Success Manager
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Farringdon seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

ContentSquare is looking for a passionate Lead Customer Success Manager (Lead CSM) to strengthen its UK team. Based in London and reporting to the Customer Success Director, in a fast-growing company, you will manage a portfolio of customers and serve as a central point of contact for the customer during the entire lifecycle of their usage of the ContentSquare Solution.


What you will do
- Account strategy planning with direct reports and building success plans to drive  value, increase adoption and grow your accounts 
- Owning the customer retention strategy, identifying gaps and amending it to reflect  regional needs and market maturity
- Tracking customer health and driving the resolution of critical escalations working  alongside our cross functional teams
- Building and growing relationships within our top accounts at the Executive level and  becoming a trusted partner
- Provide best practice and thought leadership to the customer success organization and our clients
- Establish strong partnerships with our Customer Success Teams, Ops, Product, Pre-Sales,  Sales and Marketing
- Setting clear expectations with your team and provide regular reviews, feedback and performance appraisals
- Inspiring and developing the Customer Success team. Leading the Customer Success  Managers to build a strong post-sales strategy for their portfolio of accounts to ensure our customers maximize the value on their investment in CS solutions
- Drive the growth, development and future planning of the CSM team, ensuring we  continue to delight customers, develop our people and grow/scale the business
- Reporting team performance & updates, customer updates and metrics (renewal rates, forecasting) to the Global VP of Customer Success 


What you need to succeed:
- 5+ years experience in Enterprise account management and growth in the SaaS industry (ideally 2+ years in a management role)
- Experience of building and managing a team of high-performing quota-carrying individuals with an emphasis on making the customer successfulGifted in building client relationships at the exec and C-level
- Ability to translate client business goals into measurable and actionable Success Plans
- Familiar with managing and forecasting accounts using Salesforce, Gainsight or similar tools
- Experience in Digital Analytics, UX Analytics, CRO or similar MarTech
- Keen eye for identifying opportunities to test the status quo and optimise processes within a hyper-growth environment
- Passion for all things digital and ecommerce 


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance, and French family care policy after 1 year of employment
- Fun office culture with regular socials and perks ranging from go-karting, junkyard golf and rooftop curling to in-office massages, basement jazz trips, brie and boardgame evenings and movie nights
- An office fully-stocked with (decent) coffee, breakfast, fruit and snacks (plus a regular supply of chocolate hobnobs)
- Travel opportunities to our global offices for onboarding, the Hackathon, and our annual worldwide kickoff trip

jobs.title: Lead Digital Analytics Manager
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Farringdon seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

As the manager of the Product Experience team in charge of the Northern Europe portfolio, you’ll be accountable for the overall health, use cases and retention of our clients. The product experience team is in charge of two key responsibilities, the product adoption and value demonstration. This team is also a key support for the product and collaborates closely with the Product Management team to ensure the roadmap is aligned with client usage and expectations.


What you will do:
- Support & find solutions to secure the existing client base
- Build, follow and support career and development paths for your team
- Collaborate with the customer success leader team to support the growth and development of  the global team (currently 25 people)
- Implement analytics and optimisation best practices within the Product Experience team to drive value and product adoption for our clients
- Find new processes and approaches to support the team performance
- Support the workflow and manage the internal and external needs to make sure the team is working in the right direction by being data driven
- Promoting cross-team knowledge share + centralization of product knowledge
- Grow the team and identify the right skill sets
- Lead and support high-level internal projects to support the growth of a fast-growing company customer success
- Collaborate with the product team to challenge the existing roadmap and make sure it’s aligned with the existing client expectations


What you need to succeed:
- 5+ years experience in an analytical role in eCommerce/Technology/Consulting
- 3+ years experience in CRO, Optimization, digital analytics &  user experience
- Experience of building and managing a team of high-performing quota-carrying individuals with an emphasis on making the customer successful
- Problem solver mindset 
- Strong communication and client-facing experience, as well as a customer-first attitude
- Experience working remotely with clients and internal stakeholders, and building relationships via Slack/email/phone/video calls
- Passionate about all things tech!
- Comfortable in a fast-paced, high growth startup  environment
- Excited to work and collaborate cross-functionally to innovate and create new processes and opportunities


Nice to haves:
-  Web development knowledge (HTML, CSS, JS, tagging technologies)
- Skills in SQL or other data exploration languages (ie. Python, R)
- Experience with BI tools (ie. Looker, Google Data Studio, Power BI)
- Knowledge of User Experience or Cognitive Science
- Previous experience working with SaaS products


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance, and French family care policy after 1 year of employment
- Fun office culture with regular socials and perks ranging from go-karting, junkyard golf and rooftop curling to in-office massages, basement jazz trips, brie and boardgame evenings and movie nights
- An office fully-stocked with (decent) coffee, breakfast, fruit and snacks (plus a regular supply of chocolate hobnobs)
- Travel opportunities to our global offices for onboarding, the Hackathon, and our annual worldwide kickoff trip

jobs.title: Partner Success Manager
jobs.description:
Considered as an expert, facilitator and trusted coach, the Partner Success Manager ensures that our existing UK partners gain a deep understanding of the ContentSquare platform, making them able to identify solutions and strategies that drive value to their customers.
 
We will rely on you to build and maintain solid, meaningful relationships with multiple stakeholders in our partner digital agencies and consultancy firms. In this role, you’ll be the communication nexus between ContentSquare Product, Sales, Marketing, Customer Success - serving as internal reference for our partners.

On a typical day, you might be responsible for:

Partner Training – Skills Development
Training partners based on short business audits
Certification of the partner teams
Monitoring the performance of certified partners
Project management

Technical implementation
Organization and animation of project launch meetings
Operations follow-up
Scheduling management
 
Analysis
Advice and support on all types of digital issues
Co-presentation of deliverables
Configuration of the analysis tools
Analysis of navigation and performance data
Conducting co-production workshops

Internal communication
Updating project management tools
Reporting
Participation in internal or external ContentSquare events with partners
Writing success cases

We'd love to work with Teammates who have:

At least 2-3yrs SaaS or agency/consulting experience
Very good understanding of Analytics, A / B and Data activities
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Highly structured work approach, ability to manage multiple activities in parallel
Competitive nature in some field (e.g. athletics, chess, whatever)
Preferred second language but not a requirement

Why we think you'll love it here:

As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:

Realistic performance related bonuses
Excellent health and dental insurance packages
Flexible approach to working hours and holidays 
A sociable office with a monthly happiness budget with regular socials and perks ranging from go-karting, junkyard golf and rooftop curling to in-office massages, basement jazz trips, brie and boardgame evenings and movie nights
An office fully- stocked with (decent) coffee, breakfast, fruit and snacks (plus a regular supply of chocolate hobnobs 
Plenty of opportunities for training and development (you’ll get the training and personal development time to work on projects outside of your normal day to day)

jobs.title: Partner Success Manager - Digital Agencies Partnerships
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

In a few words

Considered as an expert, facilitator and trusted coach of our partner agencies and firms, the Partner Success Manager ensures that our existing partners gain a deep understanding of the Contentsquare platform, allowing them to identify solutions and strategies that drive value to their customers.
 
We will rely on you to build and maintain solid, meaningful relationships with multiple stakeholders in our partner digital agencies and consultancy f­irms. In this role, you’ll be the communication nexus between Contentsquare Product, Sales, Marketing, Customer Success - serving as internal reference for our partners.

On a typical day, you might be responsible for: 

Partner Success Management
·         Create the success plan for each Partner and own ongoing relationships with our partners’ consultants and analysts
·         Drive regular touch points (calls/reports/meetings/QBR) with the partners to report on partnership KPIs and help to promote Contentsquare news / events
·         Participate in internal or external Contentsquare events with partners
·         Engage with Partners to develop case studies
·         Coordinate with our Partner Sales team to identify new opportunities within Partner agencies and firms

Deliver advanced solution enablement to our Partner Agencies and Firms
·       Identify key users and enable them based on short business audits
·       Deliver advanced end-to-end enablement program, including platform & insights training and certification, via onsite and remote meetings
·       Guide users on their path to certification, becoming autonomous on using the platform
·       Guide users to independently deliver an end-to-enablement program onto our solution with their own customers
·       Ensure key end-users complete Levels 1-3 Certification
·       Configure and analyze Partner Agencies/Firms platform usage data

Coordinate actions to ensure satisfaction amongst our Partner Agencies and Firms
·       Ensure the adoption of the solution and provide personalized solutions for usage optimization
·       Be the voice of the Partner Agencies/Firms and provide internal feedback on how Contentsquare’s solution can be improved
·       Regularly gather feedback from Partner Agencies/Firms and share it back out to internal teams

What you'll need to succeed:
·         Strong written and verbal communication skills in French and English
·         2+ years client-facing experience in SaaS, agency or consulting experience
·         Understanding of digital analytics tools and marketing agencies
·         Fluent in a second language a plus! (Italian, Spanish...)




Please send us your CV in English with a few lines telling why you would be a great fit :) 


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Platform Engineer
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

About the role:
You will be the ideal candidate if you are passionate about DevOps and thrive on driving excellence through automation.As a team member in the platform group, you will bring your industry expertise to work with the team to navigate through challenges and work closely with peers in our global R&D.Our platform is mainly based on AWS and GCP, using open source tools, big data and homemade automation.We use many different technologies, amongst which: Ansible, Terraform, Kubernetes, Prometheus, Python, GO etc... You will also develop skills on technologies such as: Elasticsearch, Kafka, ClickHouse, Hadoop/Spark, CDNs, DNS, Load Balancers, Monitoring, Logs, etc.

Responsibilities:
- Take part in a global team with members in Paris and Tel-Aviv
- Drive core-edge technologies at scale
- Work closely with R&D peers to improve the velocity, quality and cost of our platform
- Work with developers in supporting new features, services, software releases and troubleshoot problems
- Manage big, cross R&D projects
- Impact the business through technology and new ideas 

Requirements:
- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent industry experience
- 2+ years DevOps experience, preferably in a global company
- Mastery of Linux (RedHat \ CentOS and Ubuntu)
- Experience with configuration management systems
- Experience with Kubernetes and Docker
- Experience with AWS/GCP
- Good understanding of CI/CD
- Scripting skills (Python \ GO)
- Excellent communication skills
- Motivated with a high desire to learnResults-driven with a strong commitment




We do our best to have fun as a company and as a teamYou’ll also have: a choice of PC or Mac, flexible working hours, remote days, soccer, handball, yoga, and many other activities; after work beers provided every Friday, monthly parties…and a very friendly team! Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Presales - Solution Engineer
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a fast-growing startup founded in 2012 with the mission to improve digital experiences across the board. To do this, we developed an innovative SaaS solution that helps businesses understand how people are behaving on their digital platforms and how they can optimize the customer journey.

We love having a close relationship with our customers such as Real, Tom Tailor, Cyberport, and more.

Since 2012 we have had 150% YOY growth and raised $60M in Jan 2019 to accelerate our international expansion with one goal: to become the leading Digital Experience Insights platform thanks to the infinite possibilities of AI.

With offices in Paris, London, New York, Munich and expanding throughout North America and Asia we have a great international team with tons of career opportunities, a unique environment with strong values, a fun atmosphere, a very exciting vision and culture!

You will work closely with the business development team to pitch the solution to prospective clients and support the sales process. You’ll be the technical authority on ContentSquare and will reassure the client across multiple subjects such as implementation, performance, security and the logic behind the stats and calculations in the platform.

You’ll be very commercially focused and will understand how to transfer the feature set of the platform into commercial value for the client. Rapid company growth always brings opportunities and you’ll seek these out and drive your own career forward. 

OUR ROCK STAR:
  
With great passion for technology you are known for being a resourceful person and for finding solutions when problems arise. You’ll be comfortable in front of clients and colleagues and you’ll be able to convince and influence stakeholders both internally and externally. You’ll have a mix of development and sales skills and you’ll take a very keen interest in helping to drive the product forward. You’ll also be a riot at company socials and will contribute towards our excellent culture and work/life mix. 

You’ll be technically aware of the latest front end technologies and will be able to hold your own with CTOs and influence CEOs. 


Requirements
- SaaS Sales Experience
- A solid understanding of how a web site functions
- Basic to moderate JavaScript skills
- Excellent presentation skills
- Strong interpersonal skills
- 2-4 years’ experience of supporting the sales of SaaS platforms, ideally in the analytics/optimisation/testing/personalisation space
- Fluent in German and English


Desirable
- Any experience of a modern JS framework e.g. React, Angular, Backbone.SQL
- Experience of web analytics platforms
- An understanding of UX and CRO
- Elastic Search
- French skills


Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!

jobs.title: Product Education Manager
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Farringdon seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

Position Summary:

Contentsquare is looking for a passionate and driven individual to join the growing Product Education team. The role is based in London and reports to the Head of Product Education located in Paris. You will collaborate within Product Education to elevate Contentsquare University (our E-Learning solution), deliver innovative training solutions, and enable clients on new features. As the first Product Education employee in the UK, you will be responsible for working with the wider UK Customer Success department to identify training and documentation needs and transform content into scalable digital content for our worldwide enterprise client base. Does this sound like an interesting challenge? Read on!

Position Responsibilities:

Gather feedback from regional clients and customer success teams on documentation and training gaps
Plan, develop, organize, write and edit technical documentation of our platform, methodology, new features, and use cases for our client audience
Create tutorials, step-by-step instructions, and scenarios for CS University training courses and our Help Center
Build new user onboarding experiences through digital tutorials
Prioritize, plan, and deliver content creation and update 
Bring a consistent and cohesive voice across all Contentsquare content and documentation
Comfortable delivering audio/visual content for clients (Webinars, recorded videos, etc.)
Contribute to the strategic decisions of implementing enterprise training for our wide portfolio of clients
Promote CS University adoption internally and externally

Essential skills and experience required:

Excellent written and oral communication skills
Adept at communicating technical concepts clearly and precisely
Ability to work in full autonomy
Strong attention to detail with the ability to multitask
Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Proficiency in MS Office and Google Docs
Creative, empathetic, collaborative, optimistic, and curious

Nice to Have:

Experience working with Camtasia, Articulate, Adobe Captivate, Zendesk, Appcues, and/or WalkMe
Experience working in SaaS, Analytics, and/or UX
Fluency in a second language





As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance, and French family care policy after 1 year of employment
- Fun office culture with regular socials and perks ranging from go-karting, junkyard golf and rooftop curling to in-office massages, basement jazz trips, brie and boardgame evenings and movie nights
- An office fully-stocked with (decent) coffee, breakfast, fruit and snacks (plus a regular supply of chocolate hobnobs)
- Travel opportunities to our global offices for onboarding, the Hackathon, and our annual worldwide kickoff trip

jobs.title: Project Management Officer (PMO) - Finance
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

In a few words: 

We're looking for a Project Management Officer (PMO) to join our Operational Excellence team based in Paris. Reporting to the Global Project Manager, you will take part in an international organization that values team spirit, ambition and creativity. You will work with different teams and departments (Customer Success, Sales, Marketing, Product, R&D…) with a focus on Finance projects during the first months. 

The main missions of the Operational Excellence team are to build and steer SI projects, optimize company ROI and normalize project practices & methodology. 

What you will do as a PMO: 

- Be autonomous on project management: govern & facilitate project planning (capture project requests, build action plans & schedules, prioritize tasks, coordinate actions between departments)
- Monitor project activity: set & monitor project goals & deadlines, build KPIs, quantify risks and impacts, allocate resources, involve right stakeholders from right departments to ensure on-time deliveries within high quality. 
- Coordinate projects & communicate: orchestrate project inhouse & external stakeholders, communicate updated status of the on-going projects
- Ensure project documentation & archives: document every step of the project in order to improve new and existing processes, maintain lessons learned
- Process improvement and standard development


What you'll need to succeed: 
- +2 years of related experience in Project Management and/or Operations
- **Fluent French & English (C1 level at least)**
- Strong Project Management skills: you're able to manage a project from A to Z and to prioritize your projects 
- Knowledge and interest in the financial environment - experience with Netsuite would be a must! 
- Thorough knowledge of business processes and life cycle of business data
- Ability to use and learn various software programs in order to appropriately deliver reports, analysis


Why we'd love to meet you:
- A team player that federates, you're also agile, innovative & critical thinking
- You're organized, with an ability to handle multiple projects at a time and to perform under pressure
- Customer-focused, you give a high attention to detail
- You're dynamic with strong will to always learn and improve personal efficiency


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

  • Monitor project activity: set & monitor project goals & deadlines, build KPIs, quantify risks and impacts, allocate resources, involve right stakeholders from right departments to ensure on-time deliveries within high quality.
  • Coordinate projects & communicate: orchestrate project inhouse & external stakeholders, communicate updated status of the on-going projects
  • Ensure project documentation & archives: document every step of the project in order to improve new and existing processes, maintain lessons learned
  • Process improvement and standard development

What you'll need to succeed:

  • +2 years of related experience in Project Management and/or Operations
  • Fluent French & English (C1 level at least)
  • Strong Project Management skills: you're able to manage a project from A to Z and to prioritize your projects
  • Knowledge and interest in the financial environment - experience with Netsuite would be a must!
  • Thorough knowledge of business processes and life cycle of business data
  • Ability to use and learn various software programs in order to appropriately deliver reports, analysis

Why we'd love to meet you:

  • A team player that federates, you're also agile, innovative & critical thinking
  • You're organized, with an ability to handle multiple projects at a time and to perform under pressure
  • Customer-focused, you give a high attention to detail
  • You're dynamic with strong will to always learn and improve personal efficiency

As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:

  • Plenty of opportunities for training and development
  • Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
  • Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
  • Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
  • Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
  • 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
  • Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative (SDR) - Expression of interest
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

About the job 

Reporting to the Head of Sales Development Western Europe & DACH, this role requires a driven individual who is able to achieve and excel targets and who will be able to evangelise and take a new product to market. You will help define and develop our sales process whilst understanding the key business challenges our product and services solve. We are a fast-growing company, and need people who will take initiative and ownership when executing new business. There is a great opportunity to progress within the business!

The SDR focuses on the very first stage of the sales process (mainly prospecting with rare travels). The role does NOT involve closing deals, but is still the corner stone to generate leads for our Sales team! 


On a typical day, you might:
- Evangelise a new product in the French market
- Generate business opportunities through professional, dedicated prospecting via emails, events and cold calling
- Develop C-Level relationships within target accounts
- Uncover green field territories and making them your own by becoming a subject matter expert
- Develop a sales plan, whilst creating and maintaining a monthly sales forecast
- Review the market to determine customer needs and feeding back into the business
- Meet and exceed all quarterly and annual sales quotas


We'd love to meet someone who:
- **Is fluent in French and English**
- Demonstrates an intrinsic **drive to be successful** (you show a competitive nature in some field, e.g. athletics, chess, whatever)
- Ideally has first successful experience in a similar Lead Generation, Lead Development or Inside Sales function (internships included)
- Is an easygoing person, with strong **communication and presentation skills** (verbal and written). 
- Shows interest for the **digital** sector
- Experience in both a start-up and established business is a bonus! 


Why we think you'll love it here:
- You'll have the opportunity to be part of a very exciting company currently in hyper growth, and will help build and define the company in France.
- Your salary will be competitive, with an uncapped commission structure.
- You'll be part of a sociable office with a monthly happiness budget with regular socials and perks ranging from Friday happy hours, sports lessons, quarterly team building, annual Hackathon and many surprises all along the year (Halloween, Valentine's day, Christmas...).


NB: The recruitment process on this role in on hold for now. You can still apply but you may be contacted later, when the situation improves.


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer (Tel-Aviv)
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a fast-growing startup founded in 2012 with the mission to improve digital experiences across the board. To do this, we developed an innovative SaaS solution that helps businesses understand how people are behaving on their digital platforms and how they can optimize the customer journey.

We love having a close relationship with our customers such as Walmart, Tiffany & Co, l’Occitane, Kering, L’Oréal, and more.

Since 2012 we have had 150% YOY growth and raised $60M in Jan 2019 to accelerate our international expansion with one goal: to become the leading Digital Experience Insights platform thanks to the infinite possibilities of AI.

With offices in Paris, London, New York, San Francisco, Munich, Tel Aviv and expanding throughout North America and Asia, we have a great international team with tons of career opportunities, a unique environment with strong values, a fun atmosphere, a very exciting vision and culture!

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will join a team of passionate and talented developers, designing and developing a new data architecture. 
 
We collect several billions events per day, and query hundreds of terabytes in real time. 
 
Your daily work will consist of: 
•Designing efficient architectures to store and analyze petabytes of data 
•Leading large scale projects and mentoring other developers 
•Implementing complex acquisition workflows 
•Thinking of smart data formats to serve the functionalities of the product, while minimizing the cost 
•Developing tools to help data-scientists 
....by using some open source technologies such as Kafka, Spark, Akka, ClickHouse, Elasticsearch, etc. 
 
With a minimum 6-7 years of experience, you are proficient in either Scala or Java, and ideally several other backend languages. You practice or have an interest in functional programming and seek to develop your skills in Scala. 
 
Kafka, Akka, Spark, AWS… You have had the chance to discover or work with these big data technologies. Ideally, you have some experience on a wide range of databases and you are interested in streaming. You would like to challenge yourself developing distributed infrastructure with a real time and data-intensive environment. You would like to share your skills and take part in technical choices. 
 
Why join ContentSquare’s Data Engineering team? 
•You are looking for a variety of cool projects, which will revolutionize analytics and UX with big data 
•You are interested in contributing to open source projects as well as investing in the tech scene by organizing meetups and presenting at conferences 
•You are looking for an environment where you’ll have the occasion to be a technical referent on your areas of expertise, all while taking responsibilities on strategical corporate axes.
 
If the above sounds like a great fit to you, then join us at ContentSquare and be a part of this awesome adventure. With tech teams that are as passionate as you are, cultivate knowledge sharing and strive for team cohesion. Through hackathons, and cross team innovation days, we are committed to innovate towards tomorrow’s user experience. 
 
Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!




Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Data Collection
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

ContentSquare's Data Collection team is looking for a talented Software Engineer! The main role of the Data Collection team is the collection of raw data application and web in an innovative way without impacting the performance of our customers (the largest digital companies in France, US, and UK). For this, we develop an universal web and application tag and we are willing to integrate the most modern frameworks such as React, Angular, Vue.js, Polymer, etc.This team faces the permanent technical challenge of constantly improving our technology to make it more innovative and more efficient. 

Our web collector is executed over 100 millions times daily on a large numbers of browsers and devices, so compatibility and stability is mission critical for the team. Technology wise, our web collector is developed in TypeScript with as few dependencies as possible. Our unit tests are launched on every browser we support and our codebase has 60+% test coverage at all times. We pride ourselves with automation of building, shippings, testing, validation and automate basically anything we can get our hands on. 
With our focus on automating the mundane, engineers have only to focus on the task at hand.Our codebase and processes baked in our CI can guarantee that when Jenkins shows green it really is green. This all means our product owners can ship by themselves on a Friday afternoon and can have the confidence to do so.We are building our own progressive rollout flow, so that we can do progressively and safely rollout our code to clients.If all of the above sounds like something you believe in and would like to be a part of, please see if you also like the following requirements. 

What you will do: 
- Participate in all phases of development lifecycle, from inception to deployment monitoring
- Diagnose intricately complex issues, evaluate, recommend and execute the best resolution
- Write regression free code, with unit tests and documentation
- Implement code design, execute project deliverables and estimate scope of work
- Work in an Agile SCRUM environment and having a TDD mindset

What you will need: 
- Enthusiastic follower of good practices of development
- You have some experience with TypeScript / Javascript
- Fluent in English

Why joining our Data Collection team
- You are interested in contributing to open source projects as well as investing  yourself on the tech scene by participating in meetups and presenting topics in conferences
- You are looking for an environment where you'll have the possibility to have responsibilities and learn from more experienced developers
- You share our "quality focused" vision: code reviews, coverage of unit and functional tests, ...




Then, join us at ContentSquare and be a part of this awesome adventure, with tech teams that are as passionate as you are, who cultivate knowledge sharing and team cohesion. Through Hackathons, Cross teams Innovation Days, we are committed to experiment/create tomorrow’s user experience.
You’ll also find : the possibility to choose your PC/Mac, flexible working hours, remote days, basketball, handball, yoga, and many other sports teams, afterworks with beers provided every Fridays, monthly parties…and a very nice team !


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Software Engineer in Test
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a fast-growing startup founded in 2012 with the mission to improve digital experiences across the board. To do this, we developed an innovative SaaS solution that helps businesses understand how people are behaving on their digital platforms and how they can optimize the customer journey.

We love having a close relationship with our customers such as Walmart, Tiffany & Co, l’Occitane, Kering, L’Oréal, and more.

Since 2012 we have had 150% YOY growth and raised $60M in Jan 2019 to accelerate our international expansion with one goal: to become the leading Digital Experience Insights platform thanks to the infinite possibilities of AI.

With offices in Paris, London, New York, San Francisco, Munich, Tel Aviv and expanding throughout North America and Asia, we have a great international team with tons of career opportunities, a unique environment with strong values, a fun atmosphere, a very exciting vision and culture!

The Test and Release Engineering team at Contentsquare is a multi-functional team comprising of SETs who works across the techno-functional perimeter. The main responsibility of a SET is to make sure the AUT is stretched to the fullest, often beyond its supposed limits to ensure coherence, stability and throughput. To make sure this process is scalable and reproducible, the SETs are a lot more than just testers. In addition to working with the other members of the R&D team, the SETs work closely with the other stakeholders like product management, customer success managers, sales, marketing etc. SETs help to build a safety net for Contentsquare’s solution while continuing to propagate best practices in the company.

Job Description
As a SET in Application QA Team, your main job will be to help accelerate the test automation process in your assigned team. You will be the go-to person for the developers and the product managers when it comes to software quality in your product perimeter. You will be the torchbearer for Contentsquare’s software QoS. You will be working alongside the other members of the Test Engineering team to help develop the existing test automation framework. You will design and formalise the acceptance tests which are required for the validation of the product. In a nutshell, you will be someone who understands the technology really fast, creates a toolset to facilitate automation for the smallest possible task, and can never accept NO as an answer.


Responsibilities :
- Learn how the Contentsquare solution works and get Contentsquare certified.
- Own the QA process inside a feature team, implementing QA best practices and improving on the existing testing practices.
- Test the feature both manually & automatically by implementing test cases using our automation framework.
- Enhance, maintain, and/or refactor existing automation.
- Formalise the test cases in our test case management tool to ensure distributed presence of product and test knowledge.
- Using the KPIs we have implemented for measuring testing efforts, follow and improve the test strategy in your product perimeter.
- Provide validation and support for other cross team projects intersecting with your product perimeter.
- Provide feedback to various stakeholders to improve the processes, product, etc by the means of various communication processes and tools.

Required:
- Minimum 2 years of previous work experience as a software test engineer in a web environment (web services, frontend web applications).
- Previous experience of test automation and/or interests in automation frameworks (Selenium, WebdriverIO, Cypress, etc).
- Previous experience of programming in at least one language (Javascript, Python, Java are prefered).
- Previous experience of testing web applications across multiple environments (Windows, Mac, Linux).
- At ease with GIT and the command line.Previous experience of working with CI servers (Jenkins, CircleCI, Travis CI, etc).
- Comfortable with working in a Linux environment.

Preferred:
- Previous experience of working with Docker or other containerisation technologies.
- Previous experience of working with AWS and microservice architecture.
- Previous experience of working with the ELK stack.Previous experience of agile testing, JIRA.
- ISTQB Certified.

Competencies:
- Ability to use existing tools to create complex and efficient automation toolsets.
- Comfortable interacting with a variety of stakeholders involved in the projects.
- Ability to work collaboratively with technical and functional stakeholders.
- Ability to move fast and fail faster.Ability to prioritize tasks, follow the deadlines and have a never give up attitude.
- Fluent English




Join our adventure where together we go beyond ourselves and conquer the next big challenge!

In a few words: 

As a Product Experience Manager based in Paris, you will be a part of the Customer Success team, working very closely with the Customer Success Manager and Customer Onboarding Manager.

The Product Experience team is accountable for developing a deeper understanding of Contentsquare’s product capabilities, with the aim of spreading an innovative analysis methodology to our clients. You are ideally an excellent problem solver and insight provider that shines in data storytelling.

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to contribute to the development of our rising Product Experience function within France. The ideal candidate will have experience in a client facing role using analytics tools and would easily identify web optimization opportunities. You must thrive in a startup environment, be proactive, data-driven and eager to learn.


 On a typical day, you may:
- Participate in activities that drive product adoption, active use and Contentsquare awareness across your portfolio of customers
- Advocate on the behalf of the customer and represent their needs with internal product teams
- Proactively identify customers with low adoption and develop strategies to increase usage and stickiness with the product
- Create value by producing analysis and customized workshops with the customer based on job functions and verticals while leveraging innovative approaches, tools, and methodologies in collaboration with Customer Success Managers
- Be the go-to-lead for the adoption and awareness of new features with a proactive and consultative approach with customers
- Maintain knowledge of new product features to address the customer’s business needs, including attending new feature workshops and training
- Participate in client meetings with Customer Success Managers to understand customers’ business challenges and ensure Contentsquare usage is effectively targeting the customers’ key objectives and KPIs


We’d love to meet you:
- You have **3+ years** experience in an analytical role in Technology/Consulting/SaaS/Digital
- **You are fluent in French & English**
- You hold a degree in Business, Marketing, Big data, statistics or another related UX field
- You have strong communication skills, a first client-facing experience and a customer-first attitude
- You demonstrate a strong interest in the Internet, software, and technology; Most notably, you have a good understanding of web analytics and website optimization
- You have a robust knowledge of the digital analytics market


Ways to stand out from the crowd:
- Italian, Spanish... any of those languages would be a plus
- Web development knowledge (HTML, CSS, JS, tagging technologies)
- Knowledge in CRO / AB Testing
- Skills in SQL and any other data exploration languages
- Experience with BI tools (ie Looker)
- User Experience or Cognitive Science knowledge


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

jobs.title: Sr. Manager of Marketing Operations
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in New York City, seeing explosive growth following $122 million of funding. Recognized by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.

We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioral insight.

Contentsquare’s marketing organization is scaling and hiring a Sr. Manager of Marketing Operations. In this role, we’re looking for a marketing guru, a technology enthusiast, and a master of efficiency – someone with strong execution skills who knows how to get things done.

You will be responsible for overseeing and developing current marketing processes and establishing new best practices, ensuring flawless execution of our programs and identifying areas for improvement. You will also hold the keys to the marketing technology stack, assist with global demand generation initiatives, and help us impact our approach throughout the buyer journey and customer lifecycle.


What you’ll be doing:
- Manage technical aspects of key marketing systems (marketing automation, CRM) used to generate, distribute and report on leads; optimize the technology and build the data processes that fuel the marketing team helping us measure, optimize, scale, and personalize our demand generation and nurture campaigns using automation technology and data.
- Work with the marketing & sales leadership team to forecast and implement marketing strategies that generate demand and pipeline, close business, and use allocated budget productively.
- Create new processes and offer insight into areas of improvement, continually review and enhance campaigns, and ultimately drive adoption and usage of efficient and effective marketing tools.
- Drive cross-functional collaboration and alignment with Sales Operations to optimize lead management and workflows. 
- Ensure maximization of the marketing to sales funnel increasing efficiencies and conversion rates.
- Define a holistic marketing database management strategy that supports data unification and access across our internal systems, ensures data quality, and enforces governance and measurement; partner with the sales and growth operations team to ensure data hygiene in our CRM database.
- Create an accountable team culture that balances tremendous goals directly affect pipeline influence.


Who we're looking for:
- 3-5 years of relevant experience in marketing operations, marketing retention, data and analytics, and demand generation, ideally at a high-growth B2B/SaaS company.
- Experience with lead-scoring, attribution, full-funnel lead acquisition.
- Understanding of marketing processes, digital marketing, web content planning, and content lifecycle management.
- Hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms and technology systems such as Salesforce, Marketo or Hubspot, data visualization platforms, Google Analytics, etc.
- Proven track record of inheriting and improving existing best practices and implementing new processes.
- Ability to communicate advanced technical concepts to non-technical audiences, navigate ambiguity, and manage competing priorities.
- A natural curiosity in asking “why?” and identifying the root cause of success and shortfalls.
- Analytical, thoughtful, results-driven mentality.


In addition to the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business, we also offer:

- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Competitive coverage on a variety of health, dental and vision insurance plans 
- Competitive parental leave offering after 1 year of employment
- Opportunity to contribute to a 401K
- Unlimited PTO 
- Summer Fridays
- Fun office culture with a big opportunity to make an impact on our growing US team culture, including a rotating Culture Crew (including both office and remote teams) for you to help organize regular outings such as game nights, movie nights, and happy hours
- An office fully-stocked with coffee (or an espresso machine if you'd like!), breakfast, fruit and snacks
- Trips to our global offices for onboarding, the Hackathon, and our annual worldwide kickoff trip

jobs.title: Stage Marketing (Contenu/Event) - 6 mois
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

En quelques mots

Tu veux progresser sur différentes facettes du marketing ? Tu as un vif intérêt pour la tech, en particulier le SaaS ?
Nous recherchons un(e) assistant(e) marketing pour rejoindre notre équipe Marketing France en stage pendant 6 mois !
En collaboration avec notre Content Manager et notre Event Manager, nous te proposons un rôle 360° dans lequel tu auras un impact tangible sur la conception des communications et des campagnes marketing (contenu, digital et événements).


Ta journée type
- Emails marketing (event, emailing 360°)
- Coordination des événements avec l'Event manager
- Création du contenu des landing pages
- Rédaction de posts sur notre [blog](https://contentsquare.com/fr/blog/)
- Veille quotidienne
- Toute la partie logistique nécessaire aux campagnes offline


On adorerait rencontrer quelqu'un comme toi
- Tu es étudiant avec une première expérience en marketing et tu cherches un stage à temps plein (pas d'alternance possible) 🎓
- Tu t'intéresses à l'écosystème start up : tu as envie de rejoindre un environnement où tu pourras allier passion et excellence 🚀
- Tu es dynamique, curieux et débrouillard et veux t’investir à 200% dans un projet 💪 
- Tu as le contact très facile et un bon sens du commerce 
- Tu parles aussi anglais 🌍
- Tu accordes beaucoup d’importance aux détails, et es exigeant envers toi-même et envers les autres. Ton orthographe est irréprochable 🤓
- Tu as compris qu’être fun et bosseur était possible ! 


Ce que nous pouvons t'apporter
- Contentsquare vit une évolution et une croissance exceptionnelle sur son marché en France et à l'international. Il s'agit d'un stage assorti d'une véritable autonomie, dans lequel ta capacité à proposer des idées et gérer tes missions de manière proactive seront valorisés. C'est l'occasion de monter en compétences rapidement sur des sujets variés !
- Dans notre esprit Work Hard Play Hard, tu ne seras pas en reste : happy hour du vendredi, soirées à thème, tournois de baby-foot et de ping-pong, cours de yoga... Il y en a pour tous les goûts et tes talents complémentaires seront fortement appréciés 🙃
- N'hésite pas à aller voir [notre CEO parler de Contentsquare](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sY9o-BE91xs&t=48s), ça vaut tous les discours !


Bon à savoir 
- Stage de césure ou de fin d'études de 6 mois **(pas d'alternance)**
- Début : dès que tu es disponible ⏱
- Nous sommes situés au 5 Boulevard de la Madeleine, dans le 1er arrondissement, en plein centre de Paris
- **Cette offre est valable même en période de confinement ;)** 


Si ce stage te semble avoir été écrit pour toi, n'hésite pas plus longtemps et envoie-nous ton CV accompagné de quelques lignes nous expliquant qui tu es et ce qui te motive ! 👋


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer to interns:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Reimbursement of 50% of Navigo Pass - "tickets restaurant" 
- 1 day off per month of internship
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday, quarterly parties and yoga lessons. 
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.

We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

In a few words 

As a Digital Analytics Manager in our London office, you will be a part of the Customer Success team, and working very closely with Customer Success Manager and Customer Enablement Manager. 

The Product Experience team is accountable for developing a deeper understanding of Contentsquare’s product capabilities, with the aim of spreading an innovative analysis methodology to our clients. You are ideally an excellent problem solver and insight provider that shines in data storytelling. 

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to contribute to the development of our rising Product Experience team within the UK. The ideal candidate will have experience in a client facing role using analytics tools and would easily identify web optimization opportunities. You must thrive in a startup environment, be proactive, data-driven and eager to learn.


On a typical day, you may:
- Participate in activities that drive product adoption, active use and Contentsquare awareness across your portfolio of customers
- Advocate on the behalf of the customer and represent their needs with internal product teams
- Proactively identify customers with low adoption and develop strategies to increase usage and stickiness with the product
- Create value by producing analysis and customized workshops with the customer based on job functions and verticals while leveraging innovative approaches, tools, and methodologies in collaboration with Customer Success Managers
- Be the go-to-lead for the adoption and awareness of new features with a proactive and consultative approach with customers
- Maintain knowledge of new product features to address the customer’s business needs, including attending new feature workshops and training
- Participate in client meetings with Customer Success Managers to understand customers’ business challenges and ensure Contentsquare usage is effectively targeting the customers’ key objectives and KPIs


We’d love to meet someone who:
- Has 1-3+ years experience in an analytical role in Technology/Consulting/SaaS/Digital
- Holds a degree in Business, Marketing, Big data, Statistics or another related UX field
- Has strong communication skills, a first client-facing experience and a customer-first attitude
- Has a demonstrated interest in the Internet, software, and technology; Most notably, you have a good understanding of web analytics and website optimization
- You have a robust knowledge of the digital analytics market 


Ways to stand out from the crowd:
- Fluency in a Nordic language is a plus
- Web development knowledge (HTML, CSS, JS, tagging technologies)
- Knowledge in CRO / AB Testing
- Skills in SQL and any other data exploration languages
- Experience with BI tools (ie Looker)
- User Experience or Cognitive Science knowledge


As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance, and French family care policy after 1 year of employment
- Fun office culture with regular socials and perks ranging from go-karting, junkyard golf and rooftop curling to in-office massages, basement jazz trips, brie and boardgame evenings and movie nights
- An office fully-stocked with (decent) coffee, breakfast, fruit and snacks (plus a regular supply of chocolate hobnobs)
- Travel opportunities to our global offices for onboarding, the Hackathon, and our annual worldwide kickoff trip

jobs.title: UX/UI Designer
jobs.description:
Contentsquare is a dynamic SaaS technology startup based in Paris seeing explosive growth following $122million of funding. Recognised by Gartner as one of the four most innovative ecommerce technologies in the world, and Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups, Contentsquare is a Digital Experience Analytics Platform helping brands to create better experiences online.
We work with 600+ clients globally including Unilever, L'Occitane, GoPro, Hertz, Avon and Club Med to empower their teams with behavioural insight.

In a few words

You will be based in our Paris office, working with the Customer Success team: Customer Success Managers, Data Analysts and daily in touch with the global UI team (8 designers in Paris including YOU, 4 in London & 2 in New York).


On a typidal day, you might contribute to:
- **SaaS missions:**
- Train our customers on how to solve their UX problems with graphical recommendations based on data & create training assets available online for them
- Prepare consulting workshops responding to UI/UX customers' needs
  
- **Managed services missions:**  
- Solve UX problems with operational recommendations thanks to audits and workshops for our customers
- Realise wireframes & mockups for customers
  
- **Internal missions:**  
- Participate in building internal projects at Contentsquare (about combining data and UX expertise, hackathon projects, ...) from conception to UX/UI design 
- Collaborate with our marketing team to create dedicated campaigns about UX/UI trends (blog articles, webinars, newsletters...)
- Daily contribute to Contentsquare UI expertise thanks to our global team of designers


What we're looking for: 
- **You speak fluent French and English** & you have a good knowledge of the French market
- You have **2+ years experience in UX/UI design**
- You have **excellent presentation skills** (useful in client workshops)
- You have a good knowledge of Adobe Creative Cloud: Photoshop/Illustrator
- You have a good knowledge of prototype tools: Sketch/Adobe XD/InVision
- You hold a solid knowledge of e-commerce sector: UX/UI best practices
- You know about HTML/CSS basics (bonus)


We'd love to meet someone who: 
- Is curious & creative
- Is enthusiastic with a good sense of humor
- Regularly conducts watch and benchmarks
- Is a team player with an excellent team spirit 
- Enjoys spending time with the team (parties, sports, teambuilding events...)





As well as the opportunity to have a tangible impact on the success of the global business here’s what else we offer:
- Plenty of opportunities for training and development
- Flexible approach to working hours and holidays
- Attractive people care approach with good health insurance
- Fun office culture and strong team spirit, with beers every Friday and quarterly parties
- Regular breakfasts and fruit in the office each week
- 25 days PTO + 10 days RTT
- Many benefits via our CSE such as reductions on gym membership and leisure activities

Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.
